Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with a hemispherical body. The restricted mouth creates a carina with the body. The lip is simply tapered.  The clay is of a good quality; fine, burnished with a hard tool and black, with a regular wide black band and red exterior surface.This technique is typical of the Middle Kerma.
